title: 114_hr3595
content: The Act is titled the "Increased Authorizations for the Denver VA Medical Center Construction Project Act." It increases the authorization for the Department of Veterans Affairs medical facility project from $1,050,000,000 to $1,675,000,000. Additionally, it addresses project management of super construction projects. The amendment to Section 8103 of title 38, United States Code, requires the Secretary to enter into an agreement with a non-Department Federal entity for project management services for super construction projects exceeding $100,000,000 in expenditure. The agreement includes management of project design, acquisition, construction, and contract changes, with reimbursement for all associated costs. The Construction Authorization and Choice Improvement Act authorizes a medical facility construction project in Denver, Colorado. Additionally, a super construction project defined in title 38, United States Code, is authorized after the enactment of this Act. SEC. 4 amends the Veterans Access, Choice, and Accountability Act of 2014 to limit awards and bonuses for Department of Veterans Affairs employees. The aggregate amount is capped at $100,000,000 for fiscal year 2016 and $360,000,000 for fiscal years 2017 through 2024. SEC. 5 reduces benefits for senior executive service members within the Department of Veterans Affairs convicted of certain crimes. Section 5 of the bill reduces benefits for senior executive service members in the Department of Veterans Affairs convicted of certain crimes, specifically by excluding their covered service from annuity calculations if convicted of a felony affecting their performance in the position. The bill reduces benefits for senior executive service members in the Department of Veterans Affairs convicted of a felony affecting their performance by excluding their covered service from annuity calculations if they leave employment before a final decision is made, provided they are given notice and a hearing by another federal agency. The Secretary must issue an order within seven days after a hearing determining its lawfulness. The Director of the Office of Personnel Management must recalculate the individual's annuity within 30 days of the order. The decision on covered service for annuity calculation is final and cannot be reviewed. Individuals with reduced annuity are entitled to their lump-sum credit for the covered service period. The term 'covered service' refers to the period of service for individuals facing removal or transfer actions. 'Lump-sum credit' and 'senior executive position' are also defined in this section. The term 'service' is defined in section 713(g)(3) of title 5. A clerical amendment is made to the table of sections in chapter 7 of the same title. Section 715 of title 38, United States Code, allows for reduction of benefits for individuals convicted of certain crimes. This section applies to any removal or transfer actions under section 713 of title 38. Additionally, there is authority to recoup bonuses or awards paid to employees of the Department of Veterans Affairs. Section 717 of title 38, United States Code, allows the Secretary to order repayment of bonuses or awards given to Department employees under certain conditions. Repayment can be required if deemed appropriate by the Secretary and after the employee has been given notice and a hearing by another federal agency. The Secretary has the authority to order repayment of bonuses or awards to Department employees under specific conditions. The decision on repayment is final and cannot be reviewed by any department, agency, or court. Regulations will be prescribed by the Secretary to implement this section. Section 717 of title 38, United States Code allows for recoupment of bonuses or awards paid to Department of Veterans Affairs employees. The effective date for this section is 180 days after the enactment of the Act. It does not modify the certification issued by the Office of Personnel Management and the Office of Management and Budget regarding the performance appraisal system of the Senior Executive Service of the Department of Veterans Affairs.
